title: Augument
text: First, augument the matrix with the first two columns. In other words, duplicate the first two columns, and add them to the end of the matrix.

title: Formula
text: Now, follow the formula to find the determinant. First, multiply the entries down from the row 1 column one spot, to the row 3 column 3 spot, in a diagonal fashion. Do this for the next two diagonals as well, from the row 1 column 2 spot, to the row 3 column 4 spot, and from the row 1 column 3 spot to the row 3 column 5 spot.

title: Add
text: Now, add all the previous products together. What do you get as your answer?

title: Multiply
text: Next, multiply the values from the bottom left of the matrix to the location 3 spots to the top in a diagonal. Another way to see this is a diagonal from the bottom to the top. Do this for the next 2 columns.

title: Subtract
text: Now, subtract all the values that were just multiplied from the first set of diagonal multiplications(those that you calculated previously).
